metadata.description: FedRAMP Moderate to DoD IL4 Control Mapping
metadata.source: NIST 800-53 Rev 5, DoD Cloud Computing SRG
metadata.author: FedRAMP IL4 Scanner Project

AC-1.title: Access Control Policy and Procedures
AC-1.description: The organization develops, documents, and disseminates an access control policy and procedures.
AC-1.remediation_guidance: Update access control policy to include DoD-specific restrictions including session lock requirements and privileged account limitations.

AC-2.title: Account Management
AC-2.description: The organization manages information system accounts.
AC-2.remediation_guidance: Enhance account management procedures to ensure all privileged users have separate administrative and user accounts.

AC-17.title: Remote Access
AC-17.description: The organization establishes and documents usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and implementation guidance for remote access.
AC-17.remediation_guidance: Implement DoD-specific requirements for remote access including multi-factor authentication and encryption.

AU-2.title: Audit Events
AU-2.description: The organization determines events to be audited within the information system.
AU-2.remediation_guidance: Expand audit events to include all DoD-required events including privileged function use.

IA-2.title: Identification and Authentication
IA-2.description: The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates users.
IA-2.remediation_guidance: Implement DoD-compliant multi-factor authentication for all privileged users accessing the system remotely.

SC-8.title: Transmission Confidentiality and Integrity
SC-8.description: The information system protects the confidentiality and integrity of transmitted information.
SC-8.remediation_guidance: Implement FIPS-validated encryption for all data in transit.

RA-5.title: Vulnerability Scanning
RA-5.description: The organization scans for vulnerabilities in the information system and applications.
RA-5.remediation_guidance: Enhance vulnerability scanning to include monthly credentialed scans and remediation timelines aligned with DoD requirements.

CM-6.title: Configuration Settings
CM-6.description: The organization establishes and documents configuration settings for components.
CM-6.remediation_guidance: Implement DISA STIGs as baseline for all applicable components.

SI-4.title: Information System Monitoring
SI-4.description: The organization monitors the information system to detect attacks and indicators of potential attacks.
SI-4.remediation_guidance: Enhance monitoring to include all DoD-specific requirements for event correlation and insider threat detection.

CP-9.title: Information System Backup
CP-9.description: The organization conducts backups of information system documentation and system data.
CP-9.remediation_guidance: No delta required if FedRAMP Moderate controls are properly implemented.
